input: The first thing, by way of example, is to open up discussion about the need for the program of the party or the movement to make clear the centrality and importance of sugar and textiles in Mauritius.
target: Dabor bizen ena deba lor nesesite pu Program-la, ki li pu parti-la ubyen enn muvman pli larz, rann li byen kler pu tu dimunn ziska ki pwen Disik e Textil ena enn rol inportan dan Moris.

input: So every time we talk about an “economic crisis”, it is important that we are mindful of the fact that the economy is a social relationship, it is not a production of mere “things”, but it is how we relate to society, how the power balance is organised.
target: Alor sak fwa nu koz “kriz ekonomik”, nu bizen konsyan ki lekonomi, li anfet enn relasyon sosyal, li pa zis prodiksyon “kitsoz”, me li anglob tu nu relasyon, tu nu lyen avek sosyete, li kimanyer “balans defors” organize.

input: You have the right to vote, but this does not mean that you have your democratic rights in practice, in everyday life, for real.
target: U gayn drwa de vot me sa pa vedir ki u ena bann drwa demokratik reel, dan lapratik, konkretman.
